baseFeats.text: You have tapped into the ancient magic used by  alghollthu  masters (also known as aboleths) to mold the flesh of your ancestors. You can use this magic to transfigure other beings. You gain 3rd-level  feet to fins  and 2nd-level  water breathing  as arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these arcane innate spells once per day.

baseFeats.name: Absorb Toxin
baseFeats.prereqs: You are not immune to diseases or poisons
baseFeats.benefits: Your skin readily absorbs poison and can consciously draw toxins into your body to spare others.
baseFeats.text: Your skin readily absorbs poison and can consciously draw toxins into your body to spare others. Attempt a  counteract  check against the triggering effect; your counteract level equals half your level (rounded up), and for the roll use either your class DC –10 or your spellcasting ability modifier plus your spellcasting proficiency bonus. If you counteract the triggering effect, you end the effect for all other creatures in the area; however, you must still save against the effect with a –2 penalty to the initial save.

baseFeats.name: Accursed Claws
baseFeats.benefits: Your claws carry your mother's hag magic.
baseFeats.text: Your claws carry your mother's hag magic. When you critically hit with a claw Strike, the target takes an additional 1d4  persistent mental damage .

baseFeats.name: Agathion Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The harmonious magic of Nirvana flows through you.
baseFeats.text: The harmonious magic of  Nirvana  flows through you. You can cast  animal form  and  calm emotions  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Aggravating Scratch
baseFeats.benefits: Your claws carry an irritant that is harmless to you but can be damaging to others.
baseFeats.text: Your claws carry an irritant that is harmless to you but can be damaging to others. Your claw Strikes deal an additional 1d4  persistent poison damage  on a critical hit.

baseFeats.name: Analyze Information
baseFeats.benefits: You can stoke your mind into a burst of analytical prowess.
baseFeats.text: You can stoke your mind into a burst of analytical prowess. You can cast 3rd-level  hypercognition  once per day as a divine innate spell.

baseFeats.name: Anarchic Arcana
baseFeats.benefits: The magic in your blood is unpredictable.
baseFeats.text: The magic in your blood is unpredictable. When you make your daily preparations, roll 1d12 twice and consult the following list. 1:  acid arrow ; 2:  blur ; 3:  hideous laughter ; 4:  humanoid form ; 5:  illusory object ; 6:  mirror image ; 7:  resist energy ; 8:  see invisibility ; 9:  shatter ; 10:  sound burst ; 11:  spider climb ; 12:  telekinetic maneuver . You can cast each of those two spells once during the following day (or one spell twice if you rolled doubles) as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Ancillary Motes
baseFeats.benefits: You can use Crystalline Dust one more time per day.
baseFeats.text: You can use Crystalline Dust one more time per day.  You can take this feat more than once, gaining one more use of Crystalline Dust per day each time.

baseFeats.name: Angelic Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You can tap into the magic of angels that runs through your blood.
baseFeats.text: You can tap into the magic of angels that runs through your blood. You can cast  humanoid form  and  remove fear  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Animal Magic
baseFeats.benefits: Your shapeshifting grants you a magical connection to the animal world.
baseFeats.text: Your shapeshifting grants you a magical connection to the animal world. You can cast  animal messenger ,  calm emotions  (animals only), and  speak with animals  as 2nd-level primal innate spells once per day each. These spells use your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

baseFeats.name: Archon Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You can tap into the heavenly magic that is your birthright.
baseFeats.text: You can tap into the heavenly magic that is your birthright. You can cast  continual flame  and  shield other  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Azarketi Purification
baseFeats.benefits: You can cast purify food and drink as a primal innate spell, but only on liquids.
baseFeats.text: You can cast  purify food and drink  as a primal innate spell, but only on liquids. You can cast this spell once every 10 minutes. You can also use your innate   on a touched creature instead of a liquid to purify their blood, giving that creature a +2 status bonus for 1 minute on their ongoing saves against  poisons  already present in their body when you cast the spell.

baseFeats.name: Azata Magic
baseFeats.benefits: Your lineage traces back to the realm of Elysium, and you can harness its magic using this connection.
baseFeats.text: Your lineage traces back to the realm of Elysium, and you can harness its magic using this connection. You can cast  glitterdust  and  remove paralysis  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Bark and Tendril
baseFeats.benefits: You wield primal magic.
baseFeats.text: You wield primal magic. You can cast  barkskin  and  entangle  as 2nd-level primal innate spells once per day each.

baseFeats.name: Battleforger
baseFeats.benefits: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments.
baseFeats.text: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments. By spending 1 hour working on a weapon or armor, you can grant it the effects of a   rune until your next daily preparations, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls for a weapon or increasing armor’s item bonus to AC by 1. This has no effect if the weapon or armor already had a   rune.

baseFeats.name: Between the Scales
baseFeats.benefits: Underestimating you is a grave mistake, but it's one others keep making.
baseFeats.text: Underestimating you is a grave mistake, but it's one others keep making. You've learned to take advantage of slips in your foes' defenses. When you Strike a  flat-footed  creature using a melee weapon or unarmed attack that has the  agile  and  finesse  traits, it gains the  backstabber  trait.

baseFeats.name: Big Mouth
baseFeats.benefits: Your cheek pouches are especially stretchy.
baseFeats.text: Your cheek pouches are especially stretchy. Instead of storing up to four items of Light Bulk in your cheek pouches, you can store up to 1 Bulk worth of items. The maximum size of a given item is unchanged.

baseFeats.name: Bloodletting Fangs
baseFeats.benefits: You emulate your vampiric parent's techniques for drawing blood from a victim.
baseFeats.text: You emulate your vampiric parent's techniques for drawing blood from a victim. Your fangs Strikes deal an additional 1d4  persistent bleed damage  on a critical hit.

baseFeats.name: Bone Caller
baseFeats.benefits: Using a mixture of dinosaur bones and the bones of your ancestors to focus your magic, you animate lizards and dinosaurs to carry messages or serve as mounts.
baseFeats.text: Using a mixture of dinosaur bones and the bones of your ancestors to focus your magic, you animate lizards and dinosaurs to carry messages or serve as mounts. You can cast  animal messenger  and  phantom steed  as primal innate spells once per day each. The animal messenger is always a Tiny dinosaur or lizard, and your innate spell transforms it from bones to flesh, even if there are no dinosaurs or lizards nearby. The   looks like a dinosaur rather than a horse but functions identically.

baseFeats.name: Breath Like Honey
baseFeats.benefits: You smell of honey and savory things.
baseFeats.text: You smell of honey and savory things. You can cast  enthrall  as a 3rd-level occult innate spell once per day, except the spell has a range of 30 feet and the  inhaled  trait instead of the  auditory  trait. Targets don't gain any circumstance bonus for disagreeing with you. Your circumstance bonus to checks to  Make an Impression  if the target can smell your breath increases to +2.

baseFeats.name: Briar Battler
baseFeats.benefits: You've learned to use roots, crevices, uneven ground, and dense underbrush to your advantage.
baseFeats.text: You've learned to use roots, crevices, uneven ground, and dense underbrush to your advantage. When you're in difficult terrain from an environmental feature, you can  Take Cover , even if the feature wouldn't ordinarily be large enough for you to Take Cover.

baseFeats.name: Brightness Seeker
baseFeats.benefits: Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes studying your surroundings in search of omens related to a particular course of action to cast augury as an innate divine spell.
baseFeats.text: Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes studying your surroundings in search of omens related to a particular course of action to cast  augury  as an innate divine spell. Unless the result of the   was “nothing,” you gain the following reaction for the next 30 minutes:   Character Guide pg. 27    You attempt an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw while performing the course of action from your  , but you haven’t rolled yet You gain a +1 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +2 status bonus if the result of the   was “woe” and you proceeded anyway.

baseFeats.name: Call of Elysium
baseFeats.benefits: The wild wonder of Elysium harmonizes within you, and in dire straits, you can share its benefits with your allies.
baseFeats.text: The wild wonder of  Elysium  harmonizes within you, and in dire straits, you can share its benefits with your allies. Your Speed increases by 5 feet; the Speed increase from this feat isn't cumulative with any Speed increase from your ancestry feats (such as  Nimble Elf ). Allies who begin their turn in combat adjacent to you gain a +5-foot status bonus to their Speed for the round.

baseFeats.name: Cantorian Rejuvenation
baseFeats.benefits: The life-giving energy that flows in your blood revitalizes you.
baseFeats.text: The life-giving energy that flows in your blood revitalizes you. You recover 4d6 Hit Points and gain 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute. When you reach 15th level, you instead recover 6d6 HP and gain 15 temporary HP.

baseFeats.name: Captivating Curiosity
baseFeats.benefits: You can snare the attentions of onlookers with your unique appearance.
baseFeats.text: You can snare the attentions of onlookers with your unique appearance. You can cast  enthrall  as a 3rd-level occult innate spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Catrina's Presence
baseFeats.benefits: You've adopted the calming presence of catrinas, the festive dead..
baseFeats.text: You've adopted the calming presence of  catrinas , the festive dead; you might have even danced with a catrina yourself! So long as you are visibly carrying fresh flowers or colorful ribbons somewhere on your person, you can cast  calm emotions  twice per day as a 2nd-level divine innate spell.

baseFeats.name: Cautious Curiosity
baseFeats.prereqs: at least one arcane or occult innate spell gained from a gnome heritage or gnome ancestry feat
baseFeats.benefits: You've learned a few magical techniques for getting yourself both into and out of trouble unnoticed.
baseFeats.text: You've learned a few magical techniques for getting yourself both into and out of trouble unnoticed. You gain  misdirection  and  silence  as 2nd-level arcane or occult innate spells. The tradition of these spells must match the tradition you use for your gnome ancestry options. You can cast each spell once per day and can target only yourself.

baseFeats.name: Cave Climber
baseFeats.benefits: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go.
baseFeats.text: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.

baseFeats.name: Celestial Wings
baseFeats.benefits: With effort, you can call forth magical wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your celestial forebears.
baseFeats.text: With effort, you can call forth magical wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your celestial forebears. These wings remain for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed while you've manifested your wings.

baseFeats.name: Ceremony of Aeon's Guidance
baseFeats.benefits: Your patron aeon has allowed you to call upon their gifts to serve their ends.
baseFeats.text: Your patron  aeon  has allowed you to call upon their gifts to serve their ends. You can cast  augury  and  calm emotions  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Ceremony of Aeon's Shield
baseFeats.benefits: Your patron aeon graced you with powers of protection.
baseFeats.text: Your patron  aeon  graced you with powers of protection. You can cast  resist energy  and  shield other  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Ceremony of Fortification
baseFeats.benefits: Your exoskeleton arranges itself into an optimal defensive shape.
baseFeats.text: Your exoskeleton arranges itself into an optimal defensive shape. When you use your Ceremony of Protection, you also gain resistance to either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage equal to half your level against the next Strike that hits you and deals one of those types of damage until the start of your next turn.

baseFeats.name: Ceremony of the Strengthened Hand
baseFeats.benefits: Your exoskeleton's weapons are even more potent.
baseFeats.text: Your exoskeleton's weapons are even more potent. If you have a claws unarmed attack, it gains the  deadly d8  trait. If you have a branch unarmed attack, it gains the  shove  and  trip  traits.

baseFeats.name: Charred Remains
baseFeats.benefits: Your next fire spell leaves embers in its wake.
baseFeats.text: Your next fire spell leaves embers in its wake. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with an area and the  fire  trait, for 1 minute, your spell's area becomes difficult terrain as well as hazardous terrain, dealing 1 fire damage for each square a creature moves through.

baseFeats.name: Cling
baseFeats.benefits: You hang onto a foe to harry them into submission.
baseFeats.text: You hang onto a foe to harry them into submission. If your target moves while you're hanging onto it, you can choose to move with the target. The target is released if you choose not to move with it, at the start of your next turn, or if the target  Escapes . Attempts to Escape from a Cling follow the rules for Escape, but use your  Acrobatics  DC and end the Cling instead of the conditions normally ended by the Escape action.  You can use this action without a free hand if your preceding Strike was made with your jaws or a similar unarmed attack you could use to hang on. The GM determines which unarmed attacks apply. Hanging on in this way prevents you from using that unarmed attack.

baseFeats.name: Close Quarters
baseFeats.benefits: You've trained to fight with allies in tunnel warrens, dense undergrowth, or similarly cramped terrain.
baseFeats.text: You've trained to fight with allies in tunnel warrens, dense undergrowth, or similarly cramped terrain. If you are Small or smaller, you can end your movement in the same square as a Small or smaller ally. No more than two creatures can share the same space when using this ability or a similar one.

baseFeats.name: Coating of Slime
baseFeats.benefits: An acidic ooze coats your limbs.
baseFeats.text: An acidic ooze coats your limbs. Your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4  persistent acid damage  on a critical hit.

baseFeats.name: Constant Gaze
baseFeats.benefits: Your eyes keep a continual watch for dangers from all sides.
baseFeats.text: Your eyes keep a continual watch for dangers from all sides. You can't be flanked by creatures of your level or lower, even when you haven't used Watchful Gaze.

baseFeats.name: Cooperative Soul
baseFeats.benefits: You have developed a soul-deep bond with your comrades and maintain an even greater degree of cooperation with them.
baseFeats.text: You have developed a soul-deep bond with your comrades and maintain an even greater degree of cooperation with them. If you are at least an expert in the skill you are  Aiding , you get a success on any outcome rolled to Aid other than a critical success.

baseFeats.name: Crystalline Cloud
baseFeats.benefits: When you use Crystalline Dust, you can spend one additional action to disperse the motes as a 10-foot-radius cloud centered on you instead of as haze; the activity gains the concentrate trait.
baseFeats.text: When you use Crystalline Dust, you can spend one additional action to disperse the motes as a 10-foot-radius cloud centered on you instead of as haze; the activity gains the  concentrate  trait. All creatures within the cloud become  concealed , and all creatures outside the cloud become concealed to creatures within it.

baseFeats.name: Cunning Climber
baseFeats.benefits: Whether you are climbing a ship’s rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can’t.
baseFeats.text: Whether you are climbing a ship's rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can't. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.

baseFeats.name: Daemon Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The magic of Abaddon runs through your blood, and you can wield that power.
baseFeats.text: The magic of Abaddon runs through your blood, and you can wield that power. You can cast  death knell  and  false life  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Dance Underfoot
baseFeats.benefits: You dart under the legs of your enemies in combat.
baseFeats.text: You dart under the legs of your enemies in combat. You can end a successful  Tumble Through  action in a Large or larger enemy's space. Also, when using the  Step Lively  feat, you can Step into the triggering enemy's space. The enemy must have limbs or otherwise leave you enough room for this maneuver, as determined by the GM. For instance, you could share space with a giant or dragon, but not an ooze.

baseFeats.name: Dangle
baseFeats.benefits: You can hang by your tail from any suitable anchor point, such as a tree branch, balcony, or rocky outcropping (subject to the GM's discretion), typically while climbing.
baseFeats.text: You can hang by your tail from any suitable anchor point, such as a tree branch, balcony, or rocky outcropping (subject to the GM's discretion), typically while climbing. While hanging, you have free use of all your other limbs, so you can perform tasks that require both hands, such as firing a bow or swinging a greatsword.

baseFeats.name: Death's Drums
baseFeats.benefits: Your life has been spent challenging death itself, and proximity to that implacable foe only makes your heart beat harder.
baseFeats.text: Your life has been spent challenging death itself, and proximity to that implacable foe only makes your heart beat harder. When you are taking  persistent damage  or your  wounded  value is 1 or greater, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saving throws.

baseFeats.name: Defensive Instincts
baseFeats.benefits: Your body tenses up when surrounded, putting you on edge just enough to anticipate an attack.
baseFeats.text: Your body tenses up when surrounded, putting you on edge just enough to anticipate an attack. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of your next turn and Step.

baseFeats.name: Demon Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You can channel the power of the Abyss through your heritage, producing terrible tangible effects.
baseFeats.text: You can channel the power of the Abyss through your heritage, producing terrible tangible effects. You can cast  paranoia  and  shatter  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Devil Magic
baseFeats.benefits: Drawing on the infernal power of your sinister forbears, you mislead your foes with magical deception.
baseFeats.text: Drawing on the infernal power of your sinister forbears, you mislead your foes with magical deception. You can cast  invisibility  and  misdirection  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Dig Up Secrets
baseFeats.benefits: You are an endless well of knowledge and can remember several vital pieces of information at once.
baseFeats.text: You are an endless well of knowledge and can remember several vital pieces of information at once. You can cast  hypercognition  as an innate occult spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Disorienting Venom
baseFeats.benefits: The venom injected by your fangs disorients your foes.
baseFeats.text: The venom injected by your fangs disorients your foes. A creature damaged by your anadi venom must attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher, or become  flat-footed  for 1 round.

baseFeats.name: Divine Countermeasures
baseFeats.benefits: You've studied your celestial heritage with the intent of better defending yourself, and you've found that your techniques are equally powerful against celestials, fiends, and other divine entities.
baseFeats.text: You've studied your celestial heritage with the intent of better defending yourself, and you've found that your techniques are equally powerful against  celestials ,  fiends , and other divine entities. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against  divine  effects.

baseFeats.name: Djinni Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The magic of djinn runs through your blood.
baseFeats.text: The magic of djinn runs through your blood. You can cast  gust of wind  and  invisibility  once per day each as 2nd-level arcane innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Dracomancer
baseFeats.benefits: Your inborn arcane power manifests as your exemplar's most time-honored spells.
baseFeats.text: Your inborn arcane power manifests as your exemplar's most time-honored spells. Choose one 1st-level spell and one 2nd-level spell from those listed for a dragon spellcaster of your draconic exemplar's type (such as  alarm ,  blur ,  invisibility , and  true strike  for a  black dragon  exemplar). Links to all types of dragons can be found  here . You can cast each of these spells once per day as arcane innate spells. You gain the trained proficiency rank in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs, and your key spellcasting ability is Charisma.

baseFeats.name: Dragon Grip
baseFeats.benefits: Your hold has a unique draconic connection.
baseFeats.text: Your hold has a unique draconic connection. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus when you attempt to  Make an Impression  on a creature with the  dragon  trait. You gain access to the  Riding Drake  animal companion.

baseFeats.name: Dragon Prince
baseFeats.benefits: The blood of the Dragon Kings runs strong in your veins.
baseFeats.text: The blood of the Dragon Kings runs strong in your veins. Your draconic heritage is clearly visible, with hair that is almost entirely crimson, azure, or the like, and that shines like a dragon’s scales. You can cast the  dragon breath  sorcerer bloodline spell as an innate arcane spell once per day, but you can use only the dragon breath that is associated with your heritage and that matches the energy type of your Dragon Spit feat. At 12th level and every 3 levels thereafter, the spell is heightened by an additional spell level.

baseFeats.name: Dragonblood Paragon
baseFeats.prereqs: Strongjaw Kobold heritage, Dracomancer, Kobold Breath, or Venomtail Kobold heritage
baseFeats.benefits: Your draconic anatomy becomes especially pronounced.
baseFeats.text: Your draconic anatomy becomes especially pronounced. You increase the power of one of the following kobold heritages or feats you have.   Increase the number of times you can cast each of the granted 1st- and 2nd-level innate spells by 1.   Creatures that critically fail their save against your Kobold Breath take 3d4  persistent damage  of the type dealt by your draconic patron.   Your jaws unarmed attack gains the  deadly d6  trait.   You produce enough venom to use the  Tail Toxin  action twice per day.

baseFeats.name: Dragon's Breath
baseFeats.benefits: You can put more effort into your Kobold Breath to channel greater draconic power, though it takes more out of you.
baseFeats.text: You can put more effort into your Kobold Breath to channel greater draconic power, though it takes more out of you. When you use Kobold Breath, you can increase the damage dice to d8s and increase the area to 60 feet for a line breath weapon or 30 feet for a cone. If you do, you can't use Kobold Breath again for 1 hour.

baseFeats.name: Duskwalker Magic
baseFeats.benefits: Your connection to psychopomps gives you the power to glimpse the near future and protect corpses from the ravages of undeath.
baseFeats.text: Your connection to psychopomps gives you the power to glimpse the near future and protect corpses from the ravages of undeath. You can cast  augury  and  gentle repose  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Earthsense
baseFeats.benefits: Your connection to earth and stone allows you to feel the slightest displacement that disturbs them, down to the shift of a pebble.
baseFeats.text: Your connection to earth and stone allows you to feel the slightest displacement that disturbs them, down to the shift of a pebble. You gain  tremorsense  as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.

baseFeats.name: Echoes in Stone
baseFeats.benefits: You pause a moment to attune your senses to the stone around you.
baseFeats.text: You pause a moment to attune your senses to the stone around you. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a new sense:  imprecise tremorsense  with a range of 20 feet.

baseFeats.name: Eclectic Sword Training
baseFeats.benefits: You were always taught that you needed to be able to use whatever weapon came your way.
baseFeats.text: You were always taught that you needed to be able to use whatever weapon came your way. You can change any of the swords designated in your Tengu Weapon Familiarity to different swords that meet the same specifications. You have to practice with a sword during your daily preparations to designate it, and the designation only lasts until your next daily preparations. This changes only your proficiency; it doesn't change your access.

baseFeats.name: Eerie Compression
baseFeats.benefits: Your limbs and even your torso can collapse in on themselves, allowing you to fit through tight spaces as though you were a Small creature.
baseFeats.text: Your limbs and even your torso can collapse in on themselves, allowing you to fit through tight spaces as though you were a Small creature. You can move at full Speed while  Squeezing .

baseFeats.name: Efreeti Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The magic of your efreeti ancestors flows through you.
baseFeats.text: The magic of your  efreeti  ancestors flows through you. You can cast  enlarge  and  illusory object  once per day each as 2nd-level arcane innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Elf Step
baseFeats.benefits: You move in a graceful dance, and even your steps are broad.
baseFeats.text: You move in a graceful dance, and even your steps are broad. You Step 5 feet twice.

baseFeats.name: Energize Wings
baseFeats.benefits: You stoke your magic to energize your wings, temporarily transforming them into glowing, majestic forms.
baseFeats.text: You stoke your magic to energize your wings, temporarily transforming them into glowing, majestic forms. For 1 minute, you gain a fly Speed of 30 feet.

baseFeats.name: Energy Blessed
baseFeats.benefits: Energy runs through your blood more powerfully.
baseFeats.text: Energy runs through your blood more powerfully. When you use  Energy Emanation , you can create an emanation of 5 feet, 10 feet, or 15 feet. The damage increases to 6d6 plus an additional 1d6 for every level you have above 9th, instead of 1d6 plus an additional 1d6 for every 2 levels above 1st.

baseFeats.name: Evade Doom
baseFeats.benefits: You can elude supernatural disaster.
baseFeats.text: You can elude supernatural disaster. When you would gain the  doomed  condition, you can attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, you don't gain the doomed condition.

baseFeats.name: Expert Longevity
baseFeats.benefits: You’ve continued to refine the knowledge and skills you’ve gained through your life.
baseFeats.text: You’ve continued to refine the knowledge and skills you’ve gained through your life. When you choose a skill in which to become trained with  Ancestral Longevity , you can also choose a skill in which you are already trained and become an expert in that skill. This lasts until your Ancestral Longevity expires.  When the effects of Ancestral Longevity and Expert Longevity expire, you can retrain one of your skill increases. The skill increase you gain from this retraining must either make you trained in the skill you chose with Ancestral Longevity or make you an expert in the skill you chose with Expert Longevity.

baseFeats.name: Fade Away
baseFeats.benefits: Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects.
baseFeats.text: Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects. You gain  invisibility  and  misdirection  as 2nd-level innate occult spells. You can target only yourself with  , and you must be the primary target of  . You can cast each spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Fell Rider
baseFeats.benefits: You have trained with your animal companion to become a terrifying, unified juggernaut on the battlefield.
baseFeats.text: You have trained with your animal companion to become a terrifying, unified juggernaut on the battlefield. Your animal companion becomes trained in  Intimidation . If your animal companion uses Support while serving as your mount, it grants you the effects of the  Aid  reaction on your first Intimidation check to  Demoralize  on the same turn, even though it can't take reactions.

baseFeats.name: Ferocious Gust
baseFeats.benefits: With heavy wing beats, you whip up a furious gust and direct it at your opponents.
baseFeats.text: With heavy wing beats, you whip up a furious gust and direct it at your opponents. This air blast has the effects of  gust of wind  with a DC equal to your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

baseFeats.name: Fey Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You can use faerie magic to hide yourself and expose hidden foes.
baseFeats.text: You can use faerie magic to hide yourself and expose hidden foes. You can cast  faerie fire  and  invisibility  each once per day as primal innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Fiendish Wings
baseFeats.benefits: You can strain to call forth bat-like or otherwise fiendish wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your fiendish ancestors.
baseFeats.text: You can strain to call forth bat-like or otherwise fiendish wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your fiendish ancestors. Once manifested, these wings remain for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed while you've manifested your wings.

baseFeats.name: First World Adept
baseFeats.prereqs: at least one primal innate spell
baseFeats.benefits: Over time your fey magic has grown stronger.
baseFeats.text: Over time your fey magic has grown stronger. You gain  faerie fire  and  invisibility  as 2nd-level primal innate spells. You can cast each of these primal innate spells once per day.

baseFeats.name: Fortuitous Shift
baseFeats.benefits: You have grown more comfortable with your penchant for supernatural disappearance.
baseFeats.text: You have grown more comfortable with your penchant for supernatural disappearance. The flat check DC of your Fortuitous Shift feat decreases to 11, and you are no longer  dazzled  if you succeed.

baseFeats.name: Fox Trick
baseFeats.benefits: You always have time for a joke or prank.
baseFeats.text: You always have time for a joke or prank. You  Create a Diversion ,  Conceal an Object , or  Hide . All creatures who witnessed your Fox Trick then wise up to it, becoming temporarily immune to your Fox Trick for 24 hours.

baseFeats.name: Freeze It!
baseFeats.benefits: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.
baseFeats.text: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you. Frigid ice runs through your veins, and you can expel frost from your body to freeze your foes. Attempt an  Athletics  check against the Fortitude DC of an adjacent foe. If you have master proficiency in Athletics, you can affect up to two adjacent foes, rolling one Athletics check against each foe.  The target becomes clumsy 2 for 1 round.  The target becomes clumsy 1 for 1 round.  The target is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

baseFeats.name: Garuda Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You are descended from the wondrous garudas, and their keen senses manifest in your magical prowess.
baseFeats.text: You are descended from the wondrous  garudas , and their keen senses manifest in your magical prowess. You can cast  blur  and  see invisibility  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Glory and Valor!
baseFeats.benefits: You are descended from the einherji, the worthy warriors of chaos.
baseFeats.text: You are descended from the einherji, the worthy warriors of chaos. You call upon your ascendant blood with a mighty cry that fills you with a revitalizing energy for 1 minute or until you critically fail a Strike, whichever comes first. For the duration, the first time each round you successfully Strike a creature of your level or higher, you regain Hit Points equal to half your level.

baseFeats.name: Grandmother's Wisdom
baseFeats.benefits: You carry the bones of your ancestors with you, and you can ask them for counsel.
baseFeats.text: You carry the bones of your ancestors with you, and you can ask them for counsel. You can cast  augury  twice per day as a 2nd-level occult innate spell.

baseFeats.name: Gripping Limbs
baseFeats.benefits: Nodules, hooks, or claws on your limbs allow you to cling to surfaces with ease.
baseFeats.text: Nodules, hooks, or claws on your limbs allow you to cling to surfaces with ease. You gain a climb Speed of 15 feet.

baseFeats.name: Group Aid
baseFeats.benefits: Your upbringing emphasized teamwork and helping your allies comes naturally to you.
baseFeats.text: Your upbringing emphasized teamwork and helping your allies comes naturally to you. After you  Aid  an ally at a skill check that doesn't have the attack trait, you can also Aid any other ally who attempts the same skill check for the same purpose that round. You do so as a free action rather than a reaction.  The preparation you did to help must still apply to the other allies, and you can Aid each ally only once. For example, if you helped lift up an ally to Aid them on an  Athletics  check to scale a wall, you could keep the same posture to give a boost to other allies attempting to scale the wall in the same round.

baseFeats.name: Guiding Luck
baseFeats.benefits: Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly.
baseFeats.text: Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly. You can use  Halfling Luck  twice per day: once in response to its normal trigger, and once when you fail a Perception check or attack roll instead of the normal trigger.

baseFeats.name: Hardy Traveler
baseFeats.benefits: There's no journey too far or burden too heavy when your friends are at your side.
baseFeats.text: There's no journey too far or burden too heavy when your friends are at your side. Increase your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits by 1. In addition, you gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to your Speed during overland travel.

baseFeats.name: Hefting Shadow
baseFeats.benefits: Your shadow can contain objects.
baseFeats.text: Your shadow can contain objects. You can Interact with your shadow to store or retrieve objects, just like you would a mundane container (meaning you spend two Interact actions total to store and then retrieve the object, for example). Your shadow can contain 2 Bulk of objects, which don't count toward the Bulk you're carrying. The items remain solid but take on a shadowy patina while stored this way. Though the items are in your shadow and can be detected normally, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to  Stealth  checks to  Conceal the Objects  unless someone knows to check your shadow for items.

baseFeats.name: Heir of the Saoc
baseFeats.benefits: In the past, you would have been a proud initiate of the Saoc Brethren.
baseFeats.text: In the past, you would have been a proud initiate of the Saoc Brethren. Today, you carry on their legacy. When you use Saoc Astrology, roll 1d4 instead; on a 1, you take a –1 penalty to the skill check. On any other result, you gain a circumstance bonus of that value (for instance, a +3 circumstance bonus on a 3).

baseFeats.name: Helpful Halfling
baseFeats.benefits: When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering.
baseFeats.text: When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering. On a critical success to  Aid , you grant your ally a +3 circumstance bonus if you have expert proficiency in the skill (rather than +2), and you grant your ally a +4 circumstance bonus if you have master proficiency (rather than +3). If you roll a critical failure on a check to Aid, you don’t give your ally a –1 circumstance penalty to their check.

baseFeats.name: Heroes' Call
baseFeats.benefits: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits.
baseFeats.text: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits. You gain  heroism  as a 3rd-level innate occult spell that you can cast once per day. If you Cast the Spell when you have half or fewer Hit Points, you also gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level.

baseFeats.name: Hungry Goblin
baseFeats.benefits: You’ll eat anything and anyone.
baseFeats.text: You’ll eat anything and anyone. Whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with your jaws unarmed attack, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute.

baseFeats.name: Improvisational Warrior
baseFeats.benefits: You have increased skill with improvised weapons.
baseFeats.text: When you use an improvised weapon, you apply the critical specialization of a  brawling  weapon to it. Depending on the shape and nature of the improvised weapon, your GM might determine another weapon group’s critical specialization is more appropriate.

baseFeats.name: Incredible Improvisation
baseFeats.benefits: A stroke of brilliance gives you a major advantage with a skill despite your inexperience.
baseFeats.text: A stroke of brilliance gives you a major advantage with a skill despite your inexperience. Gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the triggering skill check.

baseFeats.name: Inner Breath
baseFeats.benefits: Your body is capable of recycling its own air.
baseFeats.text: Your body is capable of recycling its own air. When you hold your breath, you can do so for an additional hour. At the end of this hour, your body needs to rest before it can recycle air again. This rest requires 10 minutes of exposure to breathable air.

baseFeats.name: Internal Respirator
baseFeats.benefits: Your body can internally synthesize oxygen for limited periods of time.
baseFeats.text: Your body can internally synthesize oxygen for limited periods of time. When you hold your breath, you can do so for an additional hour due to your internal air reservoirs. At the end of this hour, your air reservoirs are expended. Refilling your empty air reservoirs takes 10 minutes of exposure to breathable air.

baseFeats.name: Invoke the Elements
baseFeats.prereqs: Brine May, Snow May, Veil May, or Virga May
baseFeats.benefits: You summon an aura of shimmering heat, flurrying snow, crashing waves, or swirling wind and lightning.
baseFeats.text: You summon an aura of shimmering heat, flurrying snow, crashing waves, or swirling wind and lightning. For 1 minute, you gain  concealment  against creatures more than 5 feet away, and any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you suffers 1d12 damage (basic Reflex save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher). At 13th and 17th level, this damage increases by 1d12. A veil may changeling deals fire damage, a snow may changeling deals cold damage, a brine may changeling deals bludgeoning damage and the effect gains the  water  trait, and a virga may changeling deals electricity damage.

baseFeats.name: Irrepressible
baseFeats.benefits: You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions.
baseFeats.text: You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions. When you roll a success on a saving throw against an  emotion  effect, you get a critical success instead. If your heritage is  gutsy halfling , when you roll a critical failure on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a failure instead.

baseFeats.name: Janni Hospitality
baseFeats.benefits: You can use magic to show others desert hospitality.
baseFeats.text: You can use magic to show others desert hospitality. You can cast 2nd-level  create food  once per day and  create water  twice per day as arcane innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Janni Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The magic of jann runs through your blood.
baseFeats.text: The magic of  jann  runs through your blood. You can cast  enlarge  and  speak with animals  once per day each as 2nd-level arcane innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Juvenile Flight
baseFeats.benefits: You unfold your wings for travel and can keep them unfolded for 10 minutes.
baseFeats.text: You unfold your wings for travel and can keep them unfolded for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed while your wings are unfurled. If you have  Fledgling Flight , you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your fly Speed with Juvenile Flight. As normal, since your fly Speed is derived from your land Speed, this status bonus isn't cumulative with a status bonus to your land Speed, if you have one.

baseFeats.name: Kneel for No God
baseFeats.benefits: Your ancestors’ defiance of magic and your people’s strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you.
baseFeats.text: Your ancestors’ defiance of magic and your people’s strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you. When you use your  Call on Ancient Blood  reaction against a divine spell and roll a critical failure on the saving throw against that spell, you get a failure instead.

baseFeats.name: Larcenous Tail
baseFeats.benefits: Your tail's chaotic and independent nature causes it to perform mischief even when you don't intend it, and it can somehow steal things it shouldn't be able to handle.
baseFeats.text: Your tail's chaotic and independent nature causes it to perform mischief even when you don't intend it, and it can somehow steal things it shouldn't be able to handle. You can use your tail to  Steal  an object, though your tail still can't hold onto it at the end of your action. If you have a hand free, you can transfer the stolen object to your hand. Otherwise, your tail surreptitiously drops it on the ground in your space, where you can grab it later. Observers other than your target who haven't witnessed you stealing something with your tail are usually distracted, meaning the GM will usually decrease their Perception DCs, as normal for Stealing something.

baseFeats.name: Laughing Gnoll
baseFeats.benefits: A gnoll's sinister giggle is a sound of warning and threat.
baseFeats.text: A gnoll's sinister giggle is a sound of warning and threat. You gain the  Battle Cry  skill feat. You don't take a penalty when you attempt to  Demoralize  a creature that doesn't understand your language.

baseFeats.name: Life Leap
baseFeats.benefits: You phase through a space that a living creature occupies in a flash, spontaneously appearing on the opposite side of it in a vibrant display of colorful light.
baseFeats.text: You phase through a space that a living creature occupies in a flash, spontaneously appearing on the opposite side of it in a vibrant display of colorful light. You move from your current location to another location that's still adjacent to the same living creature, but on the opposite side or corner of the creature's space. To determine whether a position is valid, use the same rules as for flanking: a line through the center of the two spaces must pass through opposite sides or corners of the creature's space.  You pass through the creature's life force, appearing in the selected location; this doesn't trigger reactions based on movement. You must be able to see your destination, and you can't move farther than your Speed would allow.

baseFeats.name: Light from Darkness
baseFeats.benefits: You've battled the fiendish power within your nature and come out on top; whatever you decide to do with your life, for good or evil, will be your choice and your choice alone.
baseFeats.text: You've battled the fiendish power within your nature and come out on top; whatever you decide to do with your life, for good or evil, will be your choice and your choice alone. This struggle has granted you powerful resistance against the divine. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against  divine  effects.

baseFeats.name: Lucky Keepsake
baseFeats.benefits: You have a keepsake that grants you luck.
baseFeats.text: You have a keepsake that grants you luck. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against spells and magical effects at all times, not just when you use Leshy Superstition. If you lose the keepsake, you lose the bonus until you designate a new keepsake, typically over the course of a week.

baseFeats.name: Marid Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You channel the magic of marids.
baseFeats.text: You channel the magic of  marids . You can cast  hydraulic push  and  obscuring mist  each once per day as 2nd-level arcane innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Mask of Pain
baseFeats.benefits: Your mask has grown into a manifestation of your pain, which you can release.
baseFeats.text: Your mask has grown into a manifestation of your pain, which you can release. The creature you successfully Demoralized takes 2d6 mental damage, or 4d6 mental damage if you're legendary in Intimidation. The target is then temporarily immune to additional damage from Mask of Pain for 24 hours.

baseFeats.name: Morrigna's Spider Affinity
baseFeats.benefits: Much like morrignas, you feel an affinity for spiders.
baseFeats.text: Much like  morrignas , you feel an affinity for spiders. You can cast  animal messenger  (spiders only),  speak with animals  (spiders only), and  spider climb  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Mother's Mindfulness
baseFeats.benefits: You have the protective instinct your own mother lacks and will gladly suffer in another's place.
baseFeats.text: You have the protective instinct your own mother lacks and will gladly suffer in another's place. You interpose yourself in the attack's path. You become the target of the triggering attack and are automatically hit by the attack (or critically hit if the ally was critically hit), suffering the full effects in your ally's place.

baseFeats.name: Mountain's Stoutness
baseFeats.benefits: Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most before going down.
baseFeats.text: Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most before going down. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. When you have the  dying  condition, the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying value (instead of 10 + your dying value). If you also have the  Toughness  feat, the Hit Points gained from it and this feat are cumulative, and the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 6 + your dying value.

baseFeats.name: Multitalented
baseFeats.benefits: You’ve learned to split your focus between multiple classes with ease.
baseFeats.text: You've learned to split your focus between multiple classes with ease. You gain a 2nd-level  multiclass dedication feat , even if you normally couldn't take another dedication feat until you take more feats from your current archetype.  If you're a  half-elf , you don't need to meet the feat's ability score prerequisites.

baseFeats.name: Night Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You can tap into the magic that runs through your blood.
baseFeats.text: You can tap into the magic that runs through your blood. You gain  animal form  (wolf only, using the statistics for a canine) and  obscuring mist  as 2nd-level divine innate spells. You can cast each of these spells once per day.

baseFeats.name: No Evidence
baseFeats.benefits: You leave little sign when attempting to remain unseen.
baseFeats.text: You leave little sign when attempting to remain unseen. When you  Avoid Notice , you also gain the benefits of  Cover Tracks  unless you choose not to.

baseFeats.name: Occult Resistance
baseFeats.benefits: Your study of occult practices has shown you how to best defend against them.
baseFeats.text: Your study of occult practices has shown you how to best defend against them. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against  occult  effects.

baseFeats.name: Offensive Subroutine
baseFeats.benefits: Nanites augment your attacks.
baseFeats.text: Nanites augment your attacks. You can choose to activate Nanite Surge when you attempt an attack roll, instead of when you attempt a skill check. If you do, you gain a +1 status bonus to the triggering attack roll.

baseFeats.name: Otherworldly Acumen
baseFeats.prereqs: at least one innate spell gained from an elf ancestry feat
baseFeats.benefits: The arcane magic you possess grows in power and complexity.
baseFeats.text: The arcane magic you possess grows in power and complexity. Choose one common 2nd-level spell from the same tradition as an innate spell you previously gained from another elf ancestry feat (from the arcane list if you have  Otherworldly Magic , for example). You can cast that spell as an innate spell once per day, using the same tradition as the list you chose the spell from.  Your magic is adaptable. By spending 1 day of downtime, you can change the spell you chose to a different common 2nd-level spell from the same tradition.

baseFeats.name: Overcrowd
baseFeats.benefits: Your physiology is slight, and you can pack into small spaces with others of similar stature.
baseFeats.text: Your physiology is slight, and you can pack into small spaces with others of similar stature. As long as you are Small, you can end your movement in the same square as a Small ally. Only two creatures total can share the same space when using this ability or a similar one.

baseFeats.name: Pack Tactics
baseFeats.benefits: You have mastered how to hunt with your pack.
baseFeats.text: You have mastered how to hunt with your pack. If an enemy is within reach of you and at least two of your allies, that enemy is  flat-footed  against you.

baseFeats.name: Peri Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The shimmering embers of the righteous peris crackle at your fingertips.
baseFeats.text: The shimmering embers of the righteous  peris  crackle at your fingertips. You can cast  glitterdust  and  status  each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Pervasive Superstition
baseFeats.benefits: You steep yourself in superstition and practice ancient orc mental exercises for shrugging off the effects of magic.
baseFeats.text: You steep yourself in superstition and practice ancient orc mental exercises for shrugging off the effects of magic. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells and magical effects at all times.

baseFeats.name: Piercing Quills
baseFeats.benefits: Your quills can dig particularly deep into the flesh of your opponents.
baseFeats.text: Your quills can dig particularly deep into the flesh of your opponents. Your quills unarmed attack deals 1d4  persistent bleed damage  on a critical hit.

baseFeats.name: Pinch Time
baseFeats.benefits: One of your parents has a human life span and another an elven life span, with your own somewhere between.
baseFeats.text: One of your parents has a human life span and another an elven life span, with your own somewhere between. As a result, you have an unusual perspective on time, which you've learned to manifest to aid yourself in moments of stress. You gain  haste  as a 3rd-level arcane innate spell, though you can target only yourself. You can Cast this Spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Predator's Growl
baseFeats.benefits: You give a throaty growl to attempt to Demoralize a creature you just found.
baseFeats.text: You give a throaty growl to attempt to  Demoralize  a creature you just found. You don't take the –4 penalty for not sharing a language with the creature.

baseFeats.name: Preemptive Reconfiguration
baseFeats.benefits: Your body anticipates the blow.
baseFeats.text: Your body anticipates the blow. The impact area briefly reorganizes into a strengthened tissue lattice that blunts the attack. You gain resistance equal to your level to the triggering damage type, which applies against the triggering damage.  If you have the  Crystalline Dust  feat, you can use Preemptive Reconfiguration without expending a usage of the reaction for the purpose of the feat's Frequency limit. Instead, the usage counts toward your number of Crystalline Dust uses per day, as if you had used that feat instead.

baseFeats.name: Pride in Arms
baseFeats.benefits: With a shout of triumph, you grant inspiration to an ally fight on.
baseFeats.text: With a shout of triumph, you grant inspiration to an ally fight on. The triggering ally gains temporary Hit Points equal to their Constitution modifier until the end of their next turn.

baseFeats.name: Qlippoth Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You've deeply studied the secrets of your blood and can force reality to act against its own wishes.
baseFeats.text: You've deeply studied the secrets of your blood and can force reality to act against its own wishes. You can cast  blur  and  silence  once per day each as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Quill Spray
baseFeats.prereqs: Quillcoat Shisk heritage or quill unarmed attack
baseFeats.benefits: You can launch a mass of quills at opponents.
baseFeats.text: You can launch a mass of quills at opponents. You spray quills in a 30-foot cone, dealing 5d8 piercing damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a  basic  saving throw against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. On a critical failure, a creature also takes 5  persistent bleed damage . At 11th level and every even level thereafter, the piercing damage increases by 1d8 and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

baseFeats.name: Rakshasa Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You remember the secrets of your rakshasa forebears and know how to apply those memories to get results.
baseFeats.text: You remember the secrets of your  rakshasa  forebears and know how to apply those memories to get results. You can cast  humanoid form  and  illusory creature  once per day each as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Rat Form
baseFeats.benefits: You can transform into an innocuous-looking rat to scout an area or slip through tight spaces.
baseFeats.text: You can transform into an innocuous-looking rat to scout an area or slip through tight spaces. You gain the effects of a 1st-level  pest form  spell, except that you must assume the battle form of a Tiny rat.

baseFeats.name: Read the Stars
baseFeats.prereqs: trained in Astrology Lore or Occultism
baseFeats.benefits: You're incredibly skilled in iruxi astrology, and you can gain useful (if cryptic) hints from the stars' alignment.
baseFeats.text: You're incredibly skilled in iruxi astrology, and you can gain useful (if cryptic) hints from the stars' alignment. Once per night, if you can clearly see the stars, you can spend 1 hour reading the heavens to see how they relate to a particular goal, event, or activity that will occur within 1 week. The GM rolls a secret check, either a DC 28  Astrology Lore  check or a DC 32  Occultism  check. On a success, you learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, and on a critical failure, you learn a misleading cryptic clue or piece of advice.

baseFeats.name: Repair Module
baseFeats.benefits: You trigger your body's repair programming, causing your body's nanites to heal your wounds.
baseFeats.text: You trigger your body's repair programming, causing your body's nanites to heal your wounds. You gain  fast healing  equal to half your level for 1 minute. While Repair Module is active, you can't use other abilities that require the use of your nanites.

baseFeats.name: Replenishing Hydration
baseFeats.benefits: You draw life from the water around you.
baseFeats.text: You draw life from the water around you. If you submerge in water and rest for 10 minutes, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level.

baseFeats.name: Returning Throw
baseFeats.benefits: You have mastered the technique of arcing a projectile so that it returns to your hand after being thrown, though this requires a moment to precisely calculate the trajectory and possible ricochets.
baseFeats.text: You have mastered the technique of arcing a projectile so that it returns to your hand after being thrown, though this requires a moment to precisely calculate the trajectory and possible ricochets. Make a ranged Strike with a  thrown  weapon. Once the Strike is complete, the weapon arcs or ricochets back to your hand. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

baseFeats.name: Ricocheting Leap
baseFeats.benefits: You quickly use your momentum to topple and spring off of foes.
baseFeats.text: You quickly use your momentum to topple and spring off of foes. You can use Wall Jump to make additional jumps off of creatures larger than you as if they were walls. Once per turn when you make an additional jump off of a creature in this way, you can also attempt to  Shove  or  Trip  that creature as a free action.

baseFeats.name: Riptide
baseFeats.benefits: Drag a grabbed creature into nearby water
baseFeats.text: You Stride up to 10 feet to enter the water, bringing the  grabbed  creature with you into the water.

baseFeats.name: Rokoan Arts
baseFeats.benefits: Ancestral spirits have begun to bond themselves to you, granting you powers characteristic of a rokoa.
baseFeats.text: Ancestral spirits have begun to bond themselves to you, granting you powers characteristic of a rokoa. You can cast  speak with animals  and  status  as primal innate spells once per day each.

baseFeats.name: Roll with It
baseFeats.benefits: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.
baseFeats.text: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow. Your foe can move you any distance of its choice up to 30 feet in a direction of its choice (this is not forced movement, and it triggers reactions as normal). You fall prone and are stunned 1. Attempt a DC 6 flat check. On a success, you take minimum damage from the attack, and on a critical success, if the attack was a critical hit, you don’t take double damage from the critical hit.

baseFeats.name: Scalding Spit
baseFeats.benefits: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood.
baseFeats.text: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood. As long as you are taking  persistent fire damage , you gain a boiling spit ranged unarmed attack with a range of 30 feet that deals 1d6 fire damage.

baseFeats.name: Scorching Disarm
baseFeats.benefits: You make a weapon unbearable to hold.
baseFeats.text: You make a weapon unbearable to hold. Attempt an  Athletics  check to  Disarm  a target creature. You don't need to have a hand free to make this Disarm attempt. If the Disarm attempt succeeds, the target takes 4d6 fire damage unless it drops the weapon, and on a critical success, it takes 4d6 fire damage and drops the weapon. If you're legendary in Athletics, this increases to 8d6 fire damage.

baseFeats.name: Sculpt Shadows
baseFeats.benefits: You coax nearby shadows into the shape of a simple weapon or a simple tool or item, using a tiny piece of your shadow to make it solid; in doing so, you lose 1 Hit Point.
baseFeats.text: You coax nearby shadows into the shape of a simple weapon or a simple tool or item, using a tiny piece of your shadow to make it solid; in doing so, you lose 1 Hit Point. You can create only level-0 common, non-consumable  weapons , or  adventuring gear  with no intricate parts, written text, or other complicated components. The item lasts until used for a single activity, until you Sculpt Shadows again, or for 1 minute, whichever comes first. Once the duration expires, the object dissipates, and you regain the lost Hit Point unless the item was  Broken  or Destroyed. As the object holds a tiny sliver of your shadow, you can't recover the lost Hit Point until after the object dissipates.

baseFeats.name: Sense for Trouble
baseFeats.benefits: You can tell when something's off.
baseFeats.text: You can tell when something's off. You can trigger Cat's Luck after you roll initiative, in addition to its normal trigger, to reroll your Initiative and take the higher of the two results. This still counts against Cat's Luck's frequency, as normal.

baseFeats.name: Sense Thoughts
baseFeats.benefits: You have an even stranger knack for knowing what other people are thinking.
baseFeats.text: You have an even stranger knack for knowing what other people are thinking. You can cast  mind reading  as an innate occult spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Shadow Sight
baseFeats.benefits: You draw on your connection with the Shadow Plane to see through all but the deepest darkness.
baseFeats.text: You draw on your connection with the  Shadow Plane  to see through all but the deepest darkness. You gain  greater darkvision  for 1 minute.

baseFeats.name: Shaitan Magic
baseFeats.benefits: The magic of shaitans runs through your blood.
baseFeats.text: The magic of shaitans runs through your blood. You can cast  glitterdust  and  resist energy  once per day each as 2nd-level arcane innate spells.

baseFeats.name: Shared Luck (Catfolk)
baseFeats.benefits: Other creatures can benefit from your luck
baseFeats.text: When you use Cat's Luck to reroll a Reflex saving throw, any creatures you choose within 10 feet who also just failed a Reflex saving throw against the same effect (such as a single spell) can also reroll their saving throws and use the better result.

baseFeats.name: Shory Aeromancer
baseFeats.prereqs: Garundi ethnicity, Mauxi ethnicity, or Tian-Yae ethnicity
baseFeats.benefits: Your ancestors hailed from the flying cities of the Shory, and a few simple tricks have come down through the ages to you.
baseFeats.text: Your ancestors hailed from the flying cities of the Shory, and a few simple tricks have come down through the ages to you. You can cast 4th-level  fly  on yourself as an innate arcane spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Silent Step
baseFeats.benefits: You vanish with silent treads.
baseFeats.text: You vanish with silent treads. You Step, then  Hide  or  Sneak . You still need to meet the requirements to Hide or Sneak, as normal.

baseFeats.name: Skittering Scuttle
baseFeats.benefits: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies.
baseFeats.text: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies. When you use  Goblin Scuttle , you can Stride up to half your Speed instead of Stepping.

baseFeats.name: Slip into Shadow
baseFeats.prereqs: ability to cast at least one spell with the darkness trait
baseFeats.benefits: Your shadow magic bleeds into the space around you.
baseFeats.text: Your shadow magic bleeds into the space around you. Whenever you cast a spell with the darkness trait, a lingering aura of shadows reduces bright light within a 5-foot emanation around you to dim light until the end of your turn. Like in natural dim light, you can use these shadows to  Hide , but the aura still makes your overall position obvious, so you can't become  undetected  through the use of these shadows alone.

baseFeats.name: Slip the Grasp
baseFeats.benefits: You have some feature that allows you to quickly evade effects that restrain you.
baseFeats.text: You have some feature that allows you to quickly evade effects that restrain you. Attempt a check to  Escape . If you succeed, you can Stride, Step, or make a Strike with a melee unarmed attack targeting the creature you Escaped from. If you fail, you instead attempt to Escape a second time.  You increase your multiple attack penalty as appropriate for the actions you took, but only after completing both actions.

baseFeats.name: Snare Commando
baseFeats.prereqs: Snare Crafting; expert in Deception or Intimidation
baseFeats.benefits: Your snares are so befuddling that your victims rarely notice you slipping out of sight.
baseFeats.text: Your snares are so befuddling that your victims rarely notice you slipping out of sight. If you have expert proficiency in  Deception , you can  Create a Diversion  against the triggering creature. If you have expert proficiency in  Intimidation , you can instead  Demoralize  the triggering creature. If you have both, choose one of the two effects.

baseFeats.name: Soaring Flight
baseFeats.benefits: To be a tengu is to be unburdened by the concerns of the world below.
baseFeats.text: To be a tengu is to be unburdened by the concerns of the world below. You grow a pair of magical wings or expand your existing ones. For 5 minutes, you gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

baseFeats.name: Sodbuster
baseFeats.benefits: Years toiling in soil have made you an expert digger.
baseFeats.text: Years toiling in soil have made you an expert digger. You gain a burrow Speed of 10 feet through loose soil or dirt.

baseFeats.name: Solar Rejuvenation
baseFeats.benefits: If you rest outdoors for 10 minutes during the day, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level.
baseFeats.text: If you rest outdoors for 10 minutes during the day, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level. You gain this benefit in addition to any healing from  Treat Wounds . Leshies whose plant nourishment does not rely on photosynthesis require a similarly suitable environment. For example, fungus leshies need dark, damp environments and a pile of decaying plant matter.

baseFeats.name: Spirit Strikes
baseFeats.benefits: Your connection to the Boneyard empowers you to bring death to all forms of life and unlife, exploiting their weaknesses.
baseFeats.text: Your connection to the  Boneyard  empowers you to bring death to all forms of life and unlife, exploiting their weaknesses. All your weapon and unarmed Strikes are  magical  and deal 1 additional negative damage to living creatures and 1 additional positive damage to  undead .

baseFeats.name: Spore Cloud
baseFeats.benefits: You unleash a cloud of pollen or similar spores.
baseFeats.text: You unleash a cloud of pollen or similar spores. All creatures in a 10-foot emanation around you must attempt a Fortitude save using your class DC or spell DC (whichever is higher) with the following results.  Plants  and  fungi  are immune to this effect.  No effect.  The creature is  dazzled  for 1 round.  The creature is dazzled and can see only 10 feet away for 1 round.  The creature is  blinded  for 1 round.

baseFeats.name: Squad Tactics
baseFeats.benefits: You are adept at working with your allies to surround a foe.
baseFeats.text: You are adept at working with your allies to surround a foe. If an enemy is within reach of you and at least two of your allies, that enemy is  flat-footed  against you.

baseFeats.name: Stone Bones
baseFeats.benefits: Your intractable nature can help you shrug off even the most grievous injuries.
baseFeats.text: Your intractable nature can help you shrug off even the most grievous injuries. Attempt a DC 17 flat check. If you are successful, the attack becomes a normal hit.

baseFeats.name: Stonewalker
baseFeats.benefits: You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone.
baseFeats.text: You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone. You gain  meld into stone  as a 3rd-level divine innate spell that you can cast once per day.  If you have the  Stonecunning  dwarf ancestry feat, you can attempt to find unusual stonework and stonework traps that require legendary proficiency in Perception. If you have both Stonecunning and legendary proficiency in Perception, when you're not  Seeking  and the GM rolls a  secret  check for you to notice unusual stonework, you keep the bonus from Stonecunning and don't take the –2 circumstance penalty.

baseFeats.name: Strand Strider
baseFeats.benefits: Your eight legs serve you well when climbing walls and webs alike.
baseFeats.text: Your eight legs serve you well when climbing walls and webs alike. You gain a climb speed of 25 feet in your spider shape.

baseFeats.name: Strong Swimmer
baseFeats.benefits: Your swim Speed increases to match your land Speed.
baseFeats.text: Your swim Speed increases to match your land Speed.

baseFeats.name: Studious Adept
baseFeats.benefits: You achieve a breakthrough in your exploration of magic.
baseFeats.text: You achieve a breakthrough in your exploration of magic. You gain  humanoid form  and  mirror image  as 2nd-level arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these arcane innate spells once per day.

baseFeats.name: Terrain Advantage
baseFeats.benefits: You can take advantage of the terrain to bypass foes’ defenses.
baseFeats.text: You can take advantage of the terrain to bypass foes’ defenses. Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain are  flat-footed  to you. If you have a swim Speed, non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are also flat-footed to you.

baseFeats.name: Tetraelemental Assault
baseFeats.benefits: Your Elemental Assault cycles through all four elements.
baseFeats.text: Your Elemental Assault cycles through all four elements. When you use Elemental Assault, instead of choosing a single element, you can choose an element from the list when using the action, and then choose a different element at the beginning of each of your next 3 turns without spending an action; once you have chosen an element, you can't choose it again during this Elemental Assault, meaning you must select all four elements over the course of 4 turns. Each time you choose an element, until the beginning of your next turn, your Strikes deal an additional 1d6 damage of the indicated type and have the trait corresponding to that element.

baseFeats.name: Thorned Seedpod
baseFeats.benefits: When your seedpods strike a felling blow, they burst into viciously thorny vines.
baseFeats.text: When your seedpods strike a felling blow, they burst into viciously thorny vines. When you critically succeed at a seedpod Strike, vines twist and stab your foe, dealing 1d4  persistent piercing damage .

baseFeats.name: Tongue Tether
baseFeats.benefits: Your tongue can momentarily latch on as readily as your hands.
baseFeats.text: Your tongue can momentarily latch on as readily as your hands. So long as you can freely open your mouth, you do not need free hands in order to  Disarm ,  Grab an Edge , or  Trip . If you have the  Long Tongue  feat, you can Disarm, Grab an Edge, and Trip with your tongue at a distance that is 5 feet beyond your normal reach.

baseFeats.name: Tree Climber (Elf)
baseFeats.benefits: You've spent much of your life among the treetops and have become an expert at quickly and safely climbing them.
baseFeats.text: You've spent much of your life among the treetops and have become an expert at quickly and safely climbing them. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.

baseFeats.name: Uncanny Cheeks
baseFeats.benefits: You squirrel away useful objects and seem to retrieve them at just the right time.
baseFeats.text: You squirrel away useful objects and seem to retrieve them at just the right time. You gain the  Prescient Consumable  and  Prescient Planner  feats, except that you always withdraw the objects from your cheek pouches. This means the object you retrieve must fit in your cheek pouches; this is generally an item of negligible Bulk unless you also have the  Cheek Pouches  feat.

baseFeats.name: Undying Ferocity
baseFeats.benefits: You resist death's clutches with supernatural vigor.
baseFeats.text: You resist death's clutches with supernatural vigor. When you use Orc Ferocity, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level.

baseFeats.name: Unhampered Passage
baseFeats.benefits: You won't allow others to restrain you.
baseFeats.text: You won't allow others to restrain you. You can cast  freedom of movement  on yourself as a primal innate spell once per day.

baseFeats.name: Velstrac Magic
baseFeats.benefits: You know there's so much more to sensation than whips and chains—but whips and chains also have their place.
baseFeats.text: You know there's so much more to sensation than whips and chains—but whips and chains also have their place. You can cast  telekinetic maneuver  and  web  once per day each as 2nd-level divine innate spells; in both cases, the spells manifest shadowy chains rather than their usual visual signifiers.

baseFeats.name: Virtue-Forged Tattoos
baseFeats.benefits: Your tattoos are a work of eldritch genius, a masterpiece of art, magic, and skin.
baseFeats.text: Your tattoos are a work of eldritch genius, a masterpiece of art, magic, and skin. Choose a 3rd-level  arcane  spell from the same school as your Arcane Tattoos, either a common spell or another to which you have access, including a lower-level spell heightened to 3rd level if you wish. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.

baseFeats.name: Vivacious Conduit
baseFeats.benefits: Your connection to the First World has grown, and its positive energy flows into you rapidly.
baseFeats.text: Your connection to the First World has grown, and its positive energy flows into you rapidly. If you rest for 10 minutes, you gain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level. This is cumulative with any healing you receive from  Treat Wounds .

baseFeats.name: Wary Skulker
baseFeats.benefits: Ever alert, you scout for danger even when you are trying to stay hidden.
baseFeats.text: Ever alert, you scout for danger even when you are trying to stay hidden. You can perform the  Scout  exploration activity at the same time as the  Avoid Notice  exploration activity.

baseFeats.name: Water Dancer
baseFeats.benefits: You glide through the water with graceful ease.
baseFeats.text: You glide through the water with graceful ease. When in an aquatic or swamp environment, you ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. In addition, swimming up or down isn't difficult terrain for you.

baseFeats.name: Water Strider
baseFeats.benefits: Water cradles your every step, allowing you to walk on its surface.
baseFeats.text: Water cradles your every step, allowing you to walk on its surface. Stride up to your Speed. During your movement, you can move across liquids that don't support your weight. If you end your movement on a surface that can't support you, you fall into the liquid at the end of your movement. You can increase the number of actions to 3 to Stride up to three times your Speed.

baseFeats.name: Web Hunter
baseFeats.benefits: Through the careful cultivation of highly sensitive hairs, you've developed the ability to sense creatures without seeing them.
baseFeats.text: Through the careful cultivation of highly sensitive hairs, you've developed the ability to sense creatures without seeing them. You gain imprecise  tremorsense  at a range of 15 feet. When you and a creature are both touching the same anchored, threadlike object (such as a rope, webbing, or wire), your imprecise tremorsense can sense that creature at a range of 60 feet.

baseFeats.name: Well-Groomed
baseFeats.benefits: You are fastidious about keeping yourself clean
baseFeats.text: You are fastidious about keeping yourself clean, whether licking your fur or carefully using traditional catfolk hygiene products, to salubrious effect. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against  diseases . If you roll a success on a saving throw against a disease, you get a critical success instead.

baseFeats.name: Wind God's Fan
baseFeats.benefits: Your fan can stir up even more powerful winds.
baseFeats.text: Your fan can stir up even more powerful winds. You can Activate your   one additional time per day. Add the 3rd-level  wall of wind  spell to the spells contained within your fan.

baseFeats.name: Wing Step
baseFeats.benefits: With a sharp flap of your wings, you stay light on your feet as you move.
baseFeats.text: With a sharp flap of your wings, you stay light on your feet as you move. You Step twice.

baseFeats.name: Wings of Air
baseFeats.benefits: You can strain to call forth feathered or cloudy wings from your back.
baseFeats.text: You can strain to call forth feathered or cloudy wings from your back. Once manifested, these wings remain for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed while you've manifested your wings.

baseFeats.name: Accursed Clay Fist
baseFeats.prereqs: Golem Grafter Dedication; expert in unarmed attacks
baseFeats.benefits: You have replaced one of your forearms with one made of clay and infused with cursed arcane magic.
baseFeats.text: You have replaced one of your forearms with one made of clay and infused with cursed arcane magic. When you make an unarmed Strike with your clay fist and hit, your target takes a –2 status penalty to saving throws against  curse  effects for 1 hour.  The damage die for your clay fist is 1d8, and it loses the  agile  and  finesse  traits of a typical fist.

baseFeats.name: Agile Grace
baseFeats.benefits: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare.
baseFeats.text: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare. Your multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks becomes –3 for your second attack and –6 for subsequent attacks (rather than –4 and –8).

baseFeats.name: Ancestral Mage
baseFeats.benefits: The magic of your ancestry and bloodline are one and the same.
baseFeats.text: The magic of your ancestry and bloodline are one and the same. Add any innate spells you have from a heritage or an ancestry feat to your spell repertoire, meaning you can cast them using your spell slots.

baseFeats.name: Angel of Death
baseFeats.benefits: All your Strikes against a creature you have Marked for Death have the death trait, causing the mark to be instantly killed when reduced to 0 Hit Points.
baseFeats.text: All your Strikes against a creature you have Marked for Death have the  death  trait, causing the mark to be instantly killed when reduced to 0 Hit Points.
